column1: The test is performed in a hospital radiology department or in a health care provider's office.
This test may be done to diagnose the cause of urinary tract infections, especially in children who have had more than one urinary tract or bladder infection.

It is also used to diagnose and evaluate: - Difficulty emptying the bladder - Birth defects with the bladder or urethra - Narrowing of the tube that carries urine out of the bladder (urethral stricture) in males - Urinary reflux from the bladder up into the kidney
